  • Direct Known Subclasses:

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(int x,
                  int y,
                  int i_pos,
                  int j_pos,
                  processing.core.PImage[][] sprites,
                  Map map)
        Constructor for a GameObject
        Parameters:
        x - x position of the GameObject, amount of pixels to the right (for drawing)
        y - y position of the GameObject, amount of pixels downwards (for drawing)
        i_pos - the row within the map array where GameObject is located
        j_pos - the column within the map array where GameObject is located
        sprites - the sprite array, with each row corresponding to a sprite array for different movement directions
        map - the map object that the GameObject is placed within

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public abstract void tick()
        To be executed once per frame

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the position and sprite cycle of the GameObject

      • collisionCondition

        public abstract void collisionCondition(demolition.Direction d,
                                        Map map)
        Condition upon colliding with wall
        Parameters:
        d - Cardinal direction in which GameObject is colliding in
        map - Map object which the GameObject is situated in

      • sprite_cycle

        public void sprite_cycle()
        To be executed once per frame, cycles the GameObject's current_sprite being rendered to the next sprite in the array

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet app)
        To be executed once per frame, draws the GameObject using its current_sprite
        Parameters:
        app - PApplet object

      • move

        public void move(demolition.Direction d)
        Moves the GameObject in a cardinal direction, a distance of one grid space and updates its position in the map array (changing i_pos and j_pos)
        Parameters:
        d - direction of movement.

      • checkCollision

        public boolean checkCollision(demolition.Direction d,
                              Map map)
        Checks whether a collision will occur if moved in the specified direction
        Parameters:
        d - Direction of movement
        map - Map object that GameObject is moving in
        Returns:
        true if a collision will occur, false if no collision will occur

        Returns:
